channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: I begged my adviser to sell amid the market turmoil. He dragged his feet and I lost $20,000. Do I have any recourse?
item.description: “If he had moved my money out of the market weeks ago, much of my loss could have been prevented.”

item.title: Tesla earnings could offer hope for the stock. But this has to happen first.
item.description: The EV company’s investors want reassurance on sales and future projects such as robotaxis and a cheaper vehicle.

item.title: ‘She’s kept him afloat’: I’m 78 and leaving my daughter my life savings, but her partner is unemployed and doesn’t pay rent. What do I do?
item.description: “He keeps losing jobs and going on unemployment.”

item.title: My IRA and personal trading account had the biggest one-day gain ever. What will tomorrow bring?
item.description: “My personal trading account was also up 18% in one day.”

item.title: AI is pushing the limits of the physical world
item.description: Architecture often assumes a binary between built projects and theoretical ones. What physics allows in actual buildings, after all, is vastly differe...

item.title: Comau to acquire warehousing automation firm Automha in strategic expansion
item.description: Comau, an Italian robotics firm, will acquire Automha, a warehousing automation specialist, to expand into the logistics sector. The post Comau to acq...

item.title: Overly bearish investors risk writing off 2025 too soon. These strategies offer upside and downside protection.
item.description: Ed Yardeni argues that, to match the doom and gloom from Wall Street bears, the stock market would need to see a Lehman-esque meltdown.

item.title: The quest to build islands with ocean currents in the Maldives
item.description: In satellite images, the 20-odd coral atolls of the Maldives look something like skeletal remains or chalk lines at a crime scene. But these landforms...

item.title: Yahoo will give millions to a settlement fund for Chinese dissidents, decades after exposing user data
item.description: A lawsuit to hold Yahoo responsible for “willfully turning a blind eye” to the mismanagement of a human rights fund for Chinese dissidents was settled...

item.title: $8 billion of US climate tech projects have been canceled so far in 2025
item.description: This year has been rough for climate technology: Companies have canceled, downsized, or shut down at least 16 large-scale projects worth $8 billion in...

item.title: 2027 AGI forecast maps a 24-month sprint to human-level AI
item.description: The newly published AI 2027 scenario offers a detailed 2 to 3-year forecast for the future that includes specific technical milestones.

item.title: Kollmorgen to highlight frameless servo motors at Robotics Summit
item.description: Kollmorgen will be showcasing its TBM2G series of frameless servo motors, which simplify the design of collaborative, surgical, and other robots while...

item.title: Harvard equips its RoboBee with crane fly-inspired landing gear
item.description: The RoboBee’s diminutive size and insect-like flight prowess offer intriguing possibilities for future applications. The post Harvard equips its RoboB...

item.title: How NTT Research has shifted more basic R&D into AI for the enterprise | Kazu Gomi interview
item.description: Kazu Gomi, president and CEO of NTT Research, has a big view of the technology world from his perch in Silicon Valley.

item.title: From ‘catch up’ to ‘catch us’: How Google quietly took the lead in enterprise AI
item.description: Google has surged ahead in the enterprise AI race after perceived stumbles. VentureBeat details the Gemini models, TPU advantage & agent ecosystem dri...

item.title: MISUMI acquires Fictiv for $350M to scale component offerings
item.description: To date, Fictiv has produced over 35 million commercial and prototype components for some of the world's most innovative products. The post MISUMI acq...

item.title: Windsurf: OpenAI’s potential $3B bet to drive the ‘vibe coding’ movement
item.description: A Windsurf deal would allow OpenAI to own more of the full-stack coding experience (and it would be its most expensive acquisition to date).

item.title: Identity as the new perimeter: NOV’s approach to stopping the 79% of attacks that are malware-free
item.description: NOV’s CIO led a cyber strategy fusing Zero Trust, AI, and airtight identity controls to cut threats by 35x and eliminating reimaging.

item.title: Learn about vibration control in manufacturing and robotics
item.description: Enidine vibration products can help automation machine builders to control unwanted vibration during machine operation. The post Learn about vibration...
